In addition, several pharmacologically active structural units, for example, pyridazines, 1,2,4-triazines and 1,2,3-triazoles are being explored to identify novel lead antimicrobial molecules ( Figure 3). The pyridazine derivative IX revealed promising in vitro antimicrobial activities against Gram + ve and Gram -ve bacteria in comparison with tetracycline
28 . Nagawade et al. reported that the pyridazine-3-carboxylic acid analogue X showed gratifying in vitro antibacterial results approaching that of corresponding reference, ciprofloxacin
29 . Compound containing 1,2,4-triazine nucleus XI has been reported to possess better antimicrobial activity with less toxicity than ciprofloxacin
30 . The derivative bearing 1,2,3-triazole scaffold XIIa displayed overall encouraging efficiency against all screened microbial strains except Aspergillus niger, while the other derivative XIIb exhibited better antimicrobial potency against all strains except Bacillus subtilis and Aspergillus niger
31 .
